intro: Laurentia minuta, commonly known as the small laurentia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. It has a creeping growth habit and produces small, rounded fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
